titleStmt.title: The humble petition of the well-affected Commons of England: presented to the two honourable houses of Parliament, for a speedy reformation, (which hath been long expected) both in church and state. Submissively supplicating that grand assembly; that they would be pleased to propound to, and advice with the grave and reverend synod concerning the premisses.

The humble petition of the well-affected Commons of England: presented to the two honourable houses of Parliament, for a speedy reformation, (which hath been long expected) both in church and state. Submissively supplicating that grand assembly; that they would be pleased to propound to, and advice with the grave and reverend synod concerning the premisses.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
